rebecca::framework::impl::FrameworkFactory

FrameworkFactory Class Reference

This is used to get particular instances of classes in which it is not possible to get to their concrete representations any other way. More...

Detailed Description

This is used to get particular instances of classes in which it is not possible to get to their concrete representations any other way.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

virtual ~FrameworkFactory (  )  [virtual]

Default virtual destructor.

Destroys the private implementation (m_pimpl) data.

FrameworkFactory (  )  throw (InternalProgrammerErrorException &) [private]

Default constructor to initalize the private implementation (m_pimpl) data.

This is private because this is a singelton. Use FrameworkFactory::getInstance() to get an instance of this class.

Exceptions:
InternalProgrammerErrorException is thrown only if the error is so grave that the entire AIML engine has to be shut down.

Member Function Documentation

virtual GraphBuilderFramework* getGraphBuilderFramework (  )  throw (InternalProgrammerErrorException &) [virtual]

Returns an instance of the GraphBuilderFramework.

Returns:
An instance of the GraphBuilderFramework
Exceptions:
InternalProgrammerErrorException is thrown only if the error is so grave that the entire AIML engine has to be shut down.

static FrameworkFactory* getInstance (  )  throw (InternalProgrammerErrorException &) [static]

Returns the instance of this class.

Only one instance of this class is allowed at a time since this is a singelton.

Returns:
The single instance of FrameworkFactory
Exceptions:
InternalProgrammerErrorException is thrown only if the error is so grave that the entire AIML engine has to be shut down.

FrameworkFactory* reset (  )  throw (InternalProgrammerErrorException &)

Resets the FrameworkFactory so that it will delete its current underlying instance and then recreate it.

You should rarely if EVER have to call this. This is usually used by internal factory methods.

Member Data Documentation

FrameworkFactoryImpl* m_pimpl [private]

The private implementation in which you cannot get access to.

This pointer holds the private methods and private member variables of this class. This makes ABI (Application Binary Interface) more resilient to change. See the private implementation idiom on the internet for more information about this.
